channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A federal judge just indefinitely barred the Trump administration from firing federal employees during the government shutdown
item.description: The judge previously issued a temporary restraining order against the job cuts that was set to expire on Wednesday.

item.title: From retail to tech, here are the 10 corporations that recently announced mass layoffs
item.description: Companies are pointing to factors like tariff costs, shifts in consumer spending, and investments in AI that have led them to let go of thousands.

item.title: Mike Johnson, Marjorie Taylor Greene clash in heated private GOP call over shutdown strategy
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson was briefly confronted by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene during a private House GOP call on Tuesday.

item.title: Democrats Don’t Get To Play The Patriotism Card While Embracing Anti-Americanism
item.description: The anti-Americanism within the Democrat Party leaves no room for its members to play the patriotism card in opposition to Trump.

item.title: As New Dietary Guidelines Loom, It’s Time to Flip the Food Pyramid
item.description: South Park had it right.

item.title: PayPal and UPS are sparking a late-session rally, powering stocks to fresh records
item.description: S&P added 0.4%, Dow Jones was up 0.6%, and the Nasdaq was 1% higher.

item.title: Nicolle Wallace Is Blatantly Lying About Democrats’ Assassination Prep
item.description: Wallace's claim that no Democrat has ever suggested Trump is Hitler is demonstrably false.

item.title: Oversight Committee Urges DOJ To Probe And ‘Void’ Pardons Signed By Biden’s Autopen
item.description: The committee notes Biden was, “losing command of himself,” and his executive actions, especially the pardons, cannot be deemed his own.

item.title: Senate Dem Dick Durbin accuses Trump admin of 'terrorizing people in their homes'
item.description: Democratic Sen. Dick Durbin of Illinois accused Republican President Donald Trump's administration of "terrorizing people in their homes."

item.title: Milei’s Triumph

item.title: We Need the Pro-Life Old Guard
item.description: The sidelining of pro-life intellectuals has contributed to Trump’s weakening pro-life position, including the new push for IVF.

item.title: Abrego Garcia to remain in US for high-stakes 'vindictive' prosecution hearing
item.description: The Justice Department seems to have reneged on its earlier plans to deport Abrego Garcia to Liberia by the end of October.
